other_tests.findings: Interval development of a moderate right low-attenuation pleural effusion with increase in size of a moderate to large left pleural effusion. Moderate bibasilar dependent atelectasis noted. An 8-mm cystic lesion within the tail of the pancreas is identified. Persistent peripancreatic fat stranding consistent with acute inflammation. A multiloculated fluid collection with enhancing septa in the left anterior pararenal space and into the pelvis, measuring approximately 18 SI x 3.9 TRV x 3.3 AP cm.
other_tests.changes_over_time: There has been interval development of pleural effusions with an increase in size, and there is a stable cystic lesion in the pancreas.
